qas.question: At any given time, about how much of all the people in the world has M. tuberculosis?
Approximately how many active TB cases were there in 2012?
How many patients were diagnosed with tuberculosis in 2010?
About how many people died in 2010 carrying both HIV and TB?
What percentage of the world's total population gets infected with tuberculosis every year?
How many people died from TB in 2012?
What percentage of TB deaths result in death?
How many people died in developing countries from TB?
What percentage of the population is infected by HIV each year?
How many chronic cases of TB were there total in 2012?

context: Roughly <a0_0>one-third<a0_0/> of the world's population has been infected with M. tuberculosis, with new infections occurring in about <a4_0><b8_0>1%<b8_0/><a4_0/> of the population each year. However, most infections with M. tuberculosis do not cause TB disease, and <b6_0>90–95%<b6_0/> of infections remain asymptomatic. In 2012, an estimated <a1_0><b5_0>8.6 million<b5_0/><a1_0/> chronic cases were active. In 2010, <a2_0><b9_0>8.8 million<b9_0/><a2_0/> new cases of TB were diagnosed, and <b7_0>1.20–1.45 million<b7_0/> deaths occurred, most of these occurring in developing countries. Of these 1.45 million deaths, about <a3_0>0.35 million<a3_0/> occur in those also infected with HIV.
